001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Mediator;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.BatchLossFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.DimensionLossFunction;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.LossFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.SampleLossFunction;
011
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.List;
014
015/**
016 * Represents an objective function that extends the concept of a
017 * {@link LossFunction} to provide both loss aggregation and gradient
018 * computation.
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * An {@code ObjectiveFunction} defines how the overall loss is calculated
022 * across a batch of samples, as well as how the gradients are determined
023 * for optimization algorithms (e.g., stochastic gradient descent).
024 * </p>
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Unlike {@link DimensionLossFunction}, {@link SampleLossFunction}, or
028 * {@link BatchLossFunction}, which focus on specific granularities,
029 * an objective function typically provides the entry point for a training
030 * process, combining loss evaluation and gradient calculation in one place.
031 * </p>
032 */
033@DomainObject
034@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
035public interface ObjectiveFunction extends LossFunction {
036
037    /**
038     * Calculates the aggregated loss across a batch of samples.
039     *
040     * <p>
041     * Each sample in the batch is represented as a {@link Pair} of
042     * {@code float[]} arrays, where the left element is the estimated
043     * (predicted) values and the right element is the target
044     * (expected) values. Implementations should define how individual
045     * sample losses are aggregated into a single scalar loss for the batch.
046     * </p>
047     *
048     * @param batch a list of samples, where each sample is a pair of
049     *              {@code float[]} arrays (estimated vs target)
050     * @return the aggregated loss value for the batch
051     */
052    float calculateAggregatedLoss(List<Pair<float[], float[]>> batch);
053
054    /**
055     * Determines the gradients of the objective function with respect to
056     * the estimated values, for a single sample.
057     *
058     * <p>
059     * Implementations should return a gradient array that corresponds in
060     * length and order to the {@code estimated} array, such that each entry
061     * can be used to update model parameters during optimization.
062     * </p>
063     *
064     * @param estimated the predicted values for a sample
065     * @param target    the expected target values for the sample
066     * @return an array of gradients, one per dimension of the input
067     */
068    float[] determineGradients(float[] estimated, float[] target);
069
070    /**
071     * Creates an {@link ObjectiveFunction} that minimizes the loss
072     * according to the given loss function components.
073     *
074     * <p>
075     * This factory method composes together a {@link BatchLossFunction},
076     * a {@link SampleLossFunction}, and one or more
077     * {@link DimensionLossFunction}s into a concrete
078     * {@link ObjectiveFunction} implementation. The resulting objective
079     * function calculates dimension-level errors, aggregates them into
080     * sample losses, and then aggregates those sample losses into a
081     * batch-level loss suitable for optimization.
082     * </p>
083     *
084     * <p>
085     * The intent of this method is to provide a convenient entry point
086     * for constructing custom objective functions when the optimization
087     * goal is loss minimization (as is typical in regression and
088     * classification problems).
089     * </p>
090     *
091     * @param batchLossFunction      the function used to aggregate losses
092     *                               across the entire batch
093     * @param sampleLossFunction     the function used to aggregate losses
094     *                               within a single sample
095     * @param dimensionLossFunctions one or more functions used to compute
096     *                               loss at the individual dimension level
097     * @return a composed {@link ObjectiveFunction} that minimizes loss
098     */
099    static ObjectiveFunction minimize(BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction, SampleLossFunction sampleLossFunction, DimensionLossFunction... dimensionLossFunctions) {
100        return new Impl(batchLossFunction, Pair.of(sampleLossFunction, Arrays.asList(dimensionLossFunctions)));
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * The implementation of the {@link ObjectiveFunction}.
105     *
106     * <p>
107     * {@code ObjectiveFunctionImpl} composes together different levels of
108     * loss functions — dimension, sample, and batch — to provide a complete
109     * objective function suitable for training and optimization.
110     * </p>
111     *
112     * <p>
113     * The implementation delegates responsibility as follows:
114     * <ul>
115     *   <li>Uses a {@link DimensionLossFunction} to compute per-dimension error
116     *       and gradients.</li>
117     *   <li>Uses a {@link SampleLossFunction} to aggregate dimension-level losses
118     *       into a single sample loss.</li>
119     *   <li>Uses a {@link BatchLossFunction} to aggregate sample losses into a
120     *       batch loss.</li>
121     * </ul>
122     * </p>
123     */
124    @Mediator
125    @Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
126    class Impl implements ObjectiveFunction {
127
128        private final Pair<SampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction>> sampleLossFunctions;
129        private final BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction;
130
131        private Impl(BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction, Pair<SampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction>> sampleLossFunctions) {
132            this.batchLossFunction = batchLossFunction;
133            this.sampleLossFunctions = sampleLossFunctions;
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * {@inheritDoc}
138         */
139        @Override
140        public float calculateAggregatedLoss(List<Pair<float[], float[]>> batch) {
141            return batchLossFunction.calculateBatchLoss(batch, sampleLossFunctions);
142        }
143
144        /**
145         * {@inheritDoc}
146         */
147        @Override
148        public float[] determineGradients(float[] estimated, float[] target) {
149            return sampleLossFunctions.left().determineGradients(estimated, target, sampleLossFunctions.right());
150        }
151
152    }
153}
